situation: We had a staff appreciation day, but we all got drunk by the end of the day. So now I am worried my boss will judge me or fire me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: hello

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: hi

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: can you talk about your feelings at this time

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Currently I am worried to show up to work. We had a staff appreciation Thursday and we all got super drunk in front of our boss, and I am honestly scared he will judge me or fire me.
persona: i am scared he will fire me if he finds out how drunk we all got at a staff appreciation party.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: that's really hard, have you spoken to any of your coworkers

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, we are all laughing at the matter, but you can tell our boss is looking at us different. We all showed up to work Friday hungover, and he just made lots of comments and jokes to play the part, but you can tell he is looking at me and everyone different. I do not know how to redeem myself.
persona: my boss is always looking at me funny.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would recommend speaking with him privately about the issue one on one

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That sounds a lot easier said than done. I was the one who was the most drunk. But I do now know if he knows how drunk we all got since he left after one of us got hit in the face with a golf club and had to take her to the ER. So what if I say too much and apologize for what he does not know.
persona: one of my co-workers got hit in the face with a golf club and had to be taken to the ER.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: have you tried reaching out a company hotline or maybe an hr department in your company to speak about this issue anonymously this could help with the tension between you and your boss

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: He is the doctor of the office and the 2 office managers were pretty drunk too. It was a hot mess if I have to be honest and being an office full of girls I feel like we went too far. I for one feel embarrassed, and feel like just not saying anything and it will fade away. But I know the next few weeks will be a little hard, for all of us. This one is for the books, and something I have never encountered in my 10 years of working.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I see how you feel do you think letting it fade is the best option in the long run?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think so. Somethings are sometimes better left unsaid. I just feel like avoiding it, but I do not know if anyone else would do the same. What would you do?
persona: sometimes things are better left unsaid.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I would apologize for my behavior to the manager if it was me. Just to seem professional and get in my bosses good grace.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You have guts. I think I will work on that and build the guts to talk to my boss if I ever have to. Thank you for that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You are doing your best and I think you will make the right decision that works for you

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You are right. In the end I will do the right thing, even if it takes me some time to get there.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is anything else bother you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Just that. I think you helped me with the only issue I currently have.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am happy to help!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand your concerns. Have you noticed any changes recently, like speaking slower or fidgeting more than usual?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I haven't observed much of that, like speaking slower or fidgeting more than usual.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or have you been eating more than usual?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, there has been essentially no change in my appetite or an increase in my eating habits.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you frequently been feeling down, depressed, or hopeless recently?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, I've hardly been experiencing any feelings of depression, despair, or hopelessness at all lately.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you been finding it hard to focus on tasks, like reading or watching TV, frequently?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, I haven't really had much chance to engage in activities like reading or watching TV lately.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Did you often find yourself having little interest or pleasure in doing things recently?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I haven't been deriving much pleasure or interest from activities lately, not at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have there been many moments lately where you felt like you've let yourself or your family down?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, there haven't been many instances at all recently where I felt like I've disappointed myself or my family.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: When you're unable to focus, does it affect your sleep, like having trouble sleeping?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, there hasn't been much influence on my sleep patterns due to difficulty in focusing, not much trouble sleeping at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you recently encountered thoughts of not wanting to be around or harming yourself?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: As a matter of fact, I've been encountering very little, almost none, of such thoughts of not wanting to be around or causing harm to myself.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you often been feeling tired or having little energy lately?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, I've been hardly experiencing any of that at all, feeling tired or having little energy hasn't been a common occurrence in my life lately.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I appreciate your directness in your answer.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm thankful for your concern and aid.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It sounds like you are having a tough time at work. The situation doesn't indicate depression, but discussing these concerns with someone you trust can provide a great relief.

situation: My aunt died a week ago who was 90.  Was very close to her.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi there, how are things?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hi Can I help you

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes trying to get over the passing of my aunt a week ago.
persona: my aunt died a week ago.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You tell me

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That's so sad. I am sorry!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks, it is actually a week today.  My mother has taken it particularly hard, they were best friends
persona: my mother was my best friend.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can understand very how your mom is going through hard time.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thanks.  I really have not had much time to grieve myself since she is my first priority.
persona: i have not had much time to grieve since she was my first priority.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Time will heel her. That I can assure you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Do you have any suggestions what I might try to cheer her up?  After that I can worry about myself
persona: maybe a change of scenery would do me some good.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Tell her to meditation or yoga in the morning. This will definitely helped and her mind will be  busy

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That might be ok.  I know she likes Neil Diamond.  Maybe get some of that playing while she meditates.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is wonderful idea too . She will recover soon

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Now what should I do for myself after she is better?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Be busy with your daily routine. Planning is the key

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I thought about trying some daily exercise like just walking around the block a couple times with my dog.
persona: sometimes I think about walking my dog around the block every day.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Good idea! You can take your mom along with you in the park. She will recover soon.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I thought about redecorating her house a little bit, they lived together for a long time maybe a change of scenery would do some good

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes, try to do all thgings. But do one by one. That is my advice for you

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Ok, well thanks for your help

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Your welcome

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I think when I start eating a little better things will improve too.

dialog.content: I'm sorry for your loss. Amid these changes, have you been having trouble with your sleep, either falling asleep or sleeping too much?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Actually, I wouldn't say I'm experiencing too much sleep-related issues at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand these times are tough. Have you often felt tired or experienced low energy recently?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: In response to your query, I haven't really experienced too much of the tiredness or low energy issue.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: During this tough period, have you often found yourself losing interest or pleasure in doing things?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I haven't really experienced much pleasure or interest in doing anything lately.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have people noticed you moving or speaking more slowly, or being more restless recently?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: In answer to your question, it's very rare for me to experience situations where people observe me moving or speaking slower, or seeming more restless.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand. Have you been struggling with concentrating on things like reading or watching TV?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, honestly, I haven't been able to focus much on activities like reading or watching television at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If it's not too much, have you felt like you've failed or let yourself or family down often?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I can confidently say that I don't really experience feelings of failure or letting my family down at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm here for you; do you often feel down, depressed, or perhaps hopeless?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, I don't frequently feel down, depressed, or hopeless at all.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm here, just want to know, do you often have thoughts of not being here or self-hurt?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: In reply to your query, there's barely any incident of such thoughts persisting in my mind.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you noticed any changes in your appetite recently, like eating less or more than usual?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I haven't noticed any significant change in my eating habits, really.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Thank you for being candid with your answer.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Your assistance has been invaluable during this difficult period.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Your emotions are natural during grieving. It's nice to think about changing scenes or walking your dog. Though you don't show signs of depression, keeping communication open is valuable.

situation: I feel like I won't ever get a proper job and move out of my parents' home.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello?

dialog.content: Hello, How are you?

dialog.content: I am okay

dialog.content: Of course! Everything comes at a perfect time, and we have to learn to be patient, and while waiting we can indulge in other activities that we like.

dialog.speaker: supporter

situation: Parent have been forcing me into something (a major) that i don't really enjoy. Now I don't know if I can continue for my masters. Would I fail?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hi there, how is life treating you today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hey. I'm doing fine. I guess really stressed.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I am so sorry to hear that. What are you feeling stressed about specifically?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My parents are kinda putting a lot of pressure on me to continue my education. I already got my bachelors, and I'm ok with getting my masters. But I really don't know if I want to get my Doctorate.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm in a major that I kind of like. I'm not ambitious about.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: If your heart is not in it then it does not seem worth taking the extra three (at least) years. Do you have a profession you want to go into?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I honestly don't know what I want to do in life. I don't really know anymore what I actually like. My parents really pressured me to choose what they thought is best ever since I was young.
persona: my parents put a lot of pressure on me to do well in school.
my parents are always telling me what they think is best for me.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It's really hard to make delicious on my own now when someone has been telling you something all thought your years.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I hear you :( I've been through that too. It can be hard to break away and stand against such a thing.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I'm sorry you felt the same way. It sucks :/ I feel a lot of pressure to please them, and I'm scared to voice my opinion.
persona: they say they are sorry for what they did.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: because whenever I try to talk to them, they always shun me down saying I don't know any better.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It sounds to me like it might be better for you to get away from them and form your own career and life.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Yes it is very difficult to standing up for yourself if you're being emotionally bullied.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am actually very far away from them! ( a different county to be exact). But I skype with them regularly. Because you know parents miss you.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Ah .. that makes it both more complicated and more simple.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: At the very least you are living independently

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Do you have financial independence as well?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: But I still feel like I have to please them and make decisions based on what I say. I guess it's like abuse but it a different context. I always worry that what I do may not please them.
persona: sometimes when I try to talk to them, they say I don't know what I am talking about.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you tried talking to them about how you feel or do you feel that they would not listen to you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I do. It's kinda complicated because when COVID hit I lost my job and they were supportive saying they would help me out until I got back on my feet. They don't hold that against me, thankfully.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have. Let me explain more

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Okay I am happy to listen :)

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you : ) I went to therapy for 4 years when I was away from them. 2 months ago I got the courage to talk to them about how I felt. It was to a point where I couldn't function anymore. They listened and said they are sorry. And it was all good for a while until it seems like they went back to the same thing again.

situation: Since the pandemic started my once strong friendships have become weak. we barely talk. Even my daughters God mother is not as present. I am unsure how to fortified those connections.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hi. What brings you here today?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I am having a hard time with the realization that my once strong friendships are no longer as strong. I feel disconnected with them. The limitations the pandemic has set for all of us have been great. I am unsure if I will ever regain those friendships
persona: my once strong friendships are no longer as strong.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand that.  The pandemic has been very hard to keep connected with everyone. Have you tried talking to your friends about how you are feeling?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, I have tried to message them daily, but the responses have always been clipped and or the response comes after couple days. I do feel other friendships have formed within each community, feeling a bit left out. I feel silly, like a teenage girl, who wants to be included. Just want to feel as though I am still part of their lives.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It's completely normal to feel like that. I have been in your exact shoes.  I would suggest inviting one of them out for lunch or dinner and express face to face how you are feeling right now.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I was thinking the same thing, but I am unsure I feel awkward now, I feel like I do not them as I thought I did. I am unsure why I feel this way. one of them is my daughters god mother and the text are there but they are not like they use.. I am unsure if I should ask why she has time for others and not us... just saying it makes me feel weird

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: anyone there?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: She may be going through something at home or having family issues.  We truly never know what the other person is going through unless we have that uncomfortable situation. My suggestion would be to rephrase that question slightly to her.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I agree with you, just seems really strange since we were inseparable before the pandemic. I am also aware many are going through this situation just thought my friendships were stronger and distant would not be an issue.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I will, never did I think I would hesitate whats going on..

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It's completely natural.  Instead of texting her, have you tried calling?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, I have. The conversation have been superficial, like small talk. There is nothing to share, I am guessing. My daughter has had lots of dance functions despite the pandemic and yet I have not felt supported. Perhaps shes not okay with venturing out during the pandemic.. though I do see on social media shes meeting other friends in social settings.
persona: my daughter has had lots of dance functions despite the pandemic and yet I have not felt supported.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Perhaps I need to be more open and not be so distant? Maybe its me and I am not seeing it?
persona: i am unsure if I will ever regain those friendships.

dialog.content: I was there for her babies birth, when she found out what she was having. We have shared grand moments together.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: you have helped me so much today, thank you for helping see things differently.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I'm an only child as well so I understand how you are feeling :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: you are welcome! Glad I could help!

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

situation: My husband quit his job to stay home with our teenage son who is very difficult and has been in legal trouble.  My husband feels like it is important for him to be home more but this is putting a financial strain on us and our son is causing a lot of emotion conflict.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hello

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hello, I am looking for help in managing some depression.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You've come to a good place to start.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Is there something in particular that is leaving you feeling depressed?

dialog.content: I am feeling resentful towards my husband for quitting his job, and my son for being the reason that he quit his job.
persona: my husband quit his job.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My son's behavior is causing a lot of conflict in our house and my husband not working is putting a lot of financial stress on us

dialog.speaker: seeker

persona: i have a hard time not dwelling on the negative things going on.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have an adult son who also lost his job recently, and I understand the added stress that can cause in your household.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is a really difficult position to be in.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: My son is very defiant and argues with us about everything we try and get him to do, but he expects us to give him money for fun things that he wants to do when he isn't willing to work or even help out around the house
persona: my son is very defiant and argues with us about everything we try and get him to do.
he expects us to give him money for fun things that he wants when he isn't willing to work.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Regardless of what your husband's actions are and your son's, could you possibly make the time to do things to support yourself, that even momentarily would provide you with some positive feelings?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I try to go for a run every night, that does help.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is very hard emotionally, so I am sorry you have to deal with your son's behavior.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It is hard to keep my emotions separate from what is going on with him

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is very understandable! Setting boundaries for yourself may help. Even when it's difficult, being clear with your son that you will not be giving him money could help.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Sometimes being clear with your own expectations can help him to see what won't be accepted from him as long as he is living in your home.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.content: I do struggle with expectations.  I want him to be someone that he is not willing to be, I need to let go of that and just let him be himself and not base my emotions on his choices.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I completely understand that. Especially when it comes to people we are close to, it can be hard to separate our expectations from theirs.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter

situation: 7 weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop having an affair.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Hi, I am having a tough time processing a correct decision today

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Good morning. What type of decision is troubling you?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: A few weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop our affair. It is the right choice for him because he feels he should work on his marriage. I admire that, yet It is very lonely for me right now
persona: my lover and I decided to end our affair a few weeks ago.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I can understand the feeling lonely would make you feel your decision was wrong but from an outsiders view, it was not a healthy relationship if he was already committed to someone.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You deserve something better. Someone dedicated to you.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It was a fantastic experience. we were together for 3 years. I am not mad at him, he's a good guy. He was separated when we met. But as all life, it's complicated

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I completely understand. I have been in your shoes before. I learned a lot and found out more about myself in the growing experience after the relationship ended. I'm sure there was some positives even with you at the end of the relationship now.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Each person is put in our life for a reason or season. This may just be the stepping stone to finding your soul mate. The perfect relationship won't feel so tricky in the long run and will make you feel on top of the world!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Yes, I had my eyes wide open during the process and he and I were very open with our communication. I can see lots of blessings but I am just so sad. Each day is a challenge to focus

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I can't imagine a relationship right now

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Sounds like you really but your heart in to this and I'm sure it hurts. No need to rush relationship. Falling back in love with yourself is the key first. Finding your inner happiness will make the next relationship that much better and stronger!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Treat yourself to a few solo dates to find joy in the day to day life you are now building without him.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have heard the idea of dating ones self

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I haven't been out to eat for over a year due to the pandemic situation
persona: i haven't been out to eat for over a year due to the pandemic situation.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: It can be fun! No decisons on who wants to go where. It is all about you enjoying the moment and your own company!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: No need to go out if you feel uncomfortable. Find a movie you have been wanting to watch and order some take out! Or do some online shopping while enjoying your favorite dessert or adult beverage!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: During this time with the affair, I had the strength to leave a narcissistic spouse that abused me emotionally. I am proud of myself for that.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: That is a lot to handle! I am proud of you for that as well! No one ever deserves to be abused. Some solo time to rebuild your independance may do you wonders and give you back your strength and self confidence! Seems like the past year has been emotionally draining.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: It has been. You are right about me focusing on solo time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I think you know yourself better than anyone else and are about to leap in to a new chapter of your life. You received lessons from both the past relationships and can take that forward knowing what you wish for and deserve.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you for letting me talk about this. It is a touchy topic, affairs. My heart was so loved during that time but I always told him that if he needed me to step back, I would. It has been difficult on both of us.
persona: my heart was so loved during that time but I always told him that if he needed me to step back, I would.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Being a parent, having the families meshed together, homes, work, etc.... I can understand why he feels he should try again.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Sometimes talking about why you are feeling is the best way to find closure. Keep the memories of the love and good times but know that in the end you were destined for something so much more. As adults we try so often to find happiness in others. He is a good person for wanting to try to resolve the situation for his family but that does not mean he did not love you or that your relationship was not a bright spot in his life as it was yours. I'm sure he is hurting too.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: thank you so much for saying that. It really means a lot to me and grounds me

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I have a friend that was using heroin.  She said that she has quit and is getting help and is now on suboxone.  However, I am not sure if that is the case.  There are times that I am talking with her and she has droopy sleepy eyes and kinda nods off.  I have comfronted her but she denies any drug use and gets mad and says this is why addicts go back because they get acussed even when they arent using.  Any advise on what I should do?  Should I just leave it alone and home that she is getting the help she needs?  She has 3 kids too.
persona: my daughter is addicted to heroin.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: so your probelm seems to be that you want to believe she is getting the help for her heroin problem, but you are hesitant becasuse of some of her actions when you see her>

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: yes that is correct.  I worry about her and her kids, but I am not sure if she is clean or not.
persona: i am not sure if she is getting the help she needs or not.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: thats a tough situation to be in with someone you care about, i went through a similiar situation with one of my parents, so i have somewhat of an idea where your coming from.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: I just dont want to make her mad and steer her away from me
persona: i don t want to make her mad and steer her away from me.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: are you familiar with anyone else that knows her and her situation and have they shared the same concern? the issue is, suboxone is a narcotic as well, so if shes still getting used to the effects of suboxone, it may seem like shes still using heroin, when in reality shes just struggling getting used to the suboxone

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: maybe you could sit down with her, and without accusing her in any way, ask her how the new medicine is working for her and questions of the sort in order to get a judge of how she acts and how she answers, that may be able to give you a better idea of how much your suspicions are true or not

dialog.content: I'm doing OK.  Just stressed about work.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What's been going on lately?  Is something in particular there stressing you out?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Ever since Corona hit, my work has come to a complete stop.  I'm just so worried about where my next paycheck will come from.
persona: my work has come to a complete stop since Corona hit.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh wow, that wounds really rough.  So you haven't been able to work in the same way since Corona?  Do you have any ideas of things you could do to make ends meet?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: No, my work was through a hospital and they stopped my contract.  I've been looking but not many places are hiring.
persona: my job is through a hospital and they stopped my contract.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh, I see.  That does sound really rough.  I would be feeling the exact same way you are in that situation and I'm sorry you're going through that.  I know this sounds cliche, but I do believe that things will work out.  I once heard, "It'll always work out in the end.  If it hasn't worked out, it's not the end."

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Thank you.  I appreciate your support and words.  That's very true.  Things haven't worked out yet so I just need to hang on.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I know there were some grants and loans and things specifically set aside for small businesses for the pandemic.  You might want to look into local resources and see if some are available to help you just to make ends meet for the time being?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Oh really?!  I didn't know that.  I'll have check that out.  It's so hard to know where to turn to or where to find that kind of information.  Is there a website or something?  Just knowing there might be something out there to help gives me so much hope.
persona: i am looking for a job but not many places are hiring.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: There's so much information and disinformation out there, it can be really hard to discern help.  There's one website: sba.gov that has several different options for pandemic relief for small businesses.  I don't know what are you're in but there are some local resources available from my local government websites too, you might want to check that out too!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That is wonderful!  Thank you so much for passing along that information.  I've written the website down and I'll do some searching tonight!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Just talking to you has brought my anxiety level down so much!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Excellent, I hope you're able to find some relief through this difficult time!  I have a friend who looked into it and was able to find a small grant to help him out!

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
That's hopeful to hear!  Thank you!  Do you know if there's another stimulus check coming?  Those have helped me so much.  It's also amazing what a kind person, who really listens and wants to help,
 can do for your well being as well!

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I have heard that another one is coming, and this one should be better than the last one.  It's all dependent on income, so anyone that makes less than 80k a year should be getting the full amount according to what I've heard.  I agree, they did help!  Would that ease your burden a little bit if the next one comes soon?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Great!  I will definitely qualify if that's the case.  I would be able to pay rent if we get this check soon.  It's been so hard making ends meet.  Sometimes I get so overwhelmed I feel like I can't breathe.  Any tips for that?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Hang in there, I'm sure help is on the way and your positive attitude will help carry you until then, you seem like a really strong person.  For me, I try taking really deep breaths and even meditating if it gets really bad.  Have you ever tried anything like that?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's so kind of you to say.  I try to stay positive and be strong but I often feel like I'm failing.  It helps to hear words of support that I'm going to make it through this tough time.  I've never meditate before.  Do you listen to music or just silence.  I would love to give that a shot.  I try to take deep breaths.  Oftentimes it helps but only for a moment.  Maybe mediation could help me overall for longer periods of time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You're not failing as long as you're still trying and not giving up.  All we can do sometimes is pick ourselves back up and keep plugging along.  There are a few apps available that have calming music, stories to listen to,  or even breath exercises to try.  They are all over the app stores.  It definitely helps me!  Meditation has been proven to help a lot of people in stressful situations.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That's so true!  I'm going to write that down and post it on my fridge!  Those are the words I'm going to live by for the next while.  I'll look up some apps!  Thank you for being such a great listener and supporter.  I feel so much lighter and hopeful.  I can't believe how much this has helped me.  I look forward to chatting again soon.  Thank you so much!  You have no idea how grateful I am to you right now.  I won't give up!

situation: Work is extremely stressful. I work 12 hour days and I feel like I have no time to do the things I like.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: What is stressful about your job?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Everyone I've reached out to has said the same. There are several factors that make my job stressful. The biggest issues are working from home and unrealistic deadlines.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh wow, that sounds really hard, and I can only imagine it is so difficult to be breaking into a new career entirely working from home. Even people I know who have been in their jobs a long time are struggling with remote work. It is hard if your company is not being flexible on deadlines during this time.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Have you found any strategies that have helped a tiny bit?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content:
It has been very hard in general, training has been a nightmare! I've tried to develop some coping strategies but they seem to fly out the window when i'm really stressed. I tend to
 over eat in these situations aswell.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I totally feel that! I think that has been a struggle for me during quarantine too - the "quarantine fifteen!" I have had to look for other forms of comfort to keep that at bay ... but I did bake cookies tonight :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I know I'm just an mturk rando, but the one thing I know that has helped almost everyone I know with career stress is having a mentor. Especially someone who is not at your company. Do you know anyone, even a friend of a friend, who could maybe be a sounding board for your career?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Haha you're a good rando. I would love to have someone to be a guide in my career but most of my family are blue collar workers. Whenever I vent they think its a joke because my job is cushy and pays extremely well. I'm honestly the snowflake in the family.
persona: my family thinks my job is cushy because it pays so well.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: Oh say no more! I totally get that just based on my own background as well. The only thing I could recommend is to cast a wide net when thinking about mentorship... maybe even a former professor in your field could recommend a former student who graduated a few years before you. Just a thought, but I know for myself, it's nice to have validation if the people I am working with are having unfair expectations.

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I hope that helped a bit, and if not, please let me know. We can keep chatting and dig into this a bit more if you'd like. What do you think?

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: You definitely given me some food for thought, I didn't think this would go so well lol

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: Makes me feel a little less lonely today :)

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I really enjoyed talking with you! Also, I just have to say, we are all having such a hard time with this pandemic. It's not just you - you aren't broken. You are doing your best as we alll are :)

situation: Removed from my job - apparently only because of my age - no longer doing meaningful work.

No longer supervising anyone, only doing grunt work, etc. It ticks me off and there's nothing I can do about it.
persona: my boss is trying to get rid of all the people who have been there for more than 12 years.

dialog.speaker: seeker

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I understand completely. Depression runs in my family and if it goes untreated, can scare anyone that is involved. You can try suggesting that he talks to a close friend, family member, or counselor to talk about how he is feeling and ways to cope with it. Sometimes medication could be a good way to fix the chemical imbalance that can cause depression.

dialog.content: I will try to help him, he just doesn't want to seem to talk to my anymore. Do you have any suggestions on how to approach it with him?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: You could start a conversation by saying that you just want to check on him and see if he is okay and how he is doing. You don't want to start the conversation by immediately telling him to get help, as he might just get defensive.

dialog.speaker: seeker
dialog.content: That is a good approach. And you don't think I will further upset him?

dialog.speaker: supporter
dialog.content: I don't believe it will upset him if you ease into suggesting that he should talk to someone he is close to or seeing a professional. Your main goal is to check on him and make sure that he is okay since he seems to want to be alone and not talk to anyone. Once he tells you how he is doing you could mention that even talking to someone about his thoughts and feelings could lift a weight off his shoulders. If he seems that he doesn't really know why he feels the way does, you could suggest that medically speaking, sometimes our brains don't produce the chemicals that we need them to and it could make us feel bad. Seeing a professional to get their opinion would also help greatly.

situation: My girlfriend and I broke up and I've felt terrible ever since.
